info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 17 at 5:40PM EDT until June 17 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Cabarrus County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... Southeastern Rowan County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... * Until 630 PM EDT. * At 540 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles east of Salisbury, or near Spencer, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Salisbury, Spencer, Granite Quarry, Rockwell, Mt Pleasant, Faith, High Rock Lake and Gold Hill. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to minor flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
